      double getCostOfColumnGroup​(CompressedSizeInfoColGroup g)

    • Method Detail

      • getUncompressedCost

        public double getUncompressedCost​(CompressedSizeInfoColGroup g)
        Description copied from interface: ICostEstimate
        Calculate the cost of execution if uncompressed. This is used as an optimization goal to at least achieve, since if the uncompressed cost of calculation is lower than in compressed space we don't want to compress.
        Specified by:
        getUncompressedCost in interface ICostEstimate
        Parameters:
        g - A potential column group to compare to.
        Returns:
        The uncompressed cost.

      • getCostOfColumnGroup

        public double getCostOfColumnGroup​(CompressedSizeInfoColGroup g)
        Description copied from interface: ICostEstimate
        If the instruction does not care about the inter column group cost, such as in memory cost or in computation cost of right or left matrix multiplication we simply estimate the cost of individual column groups.
        Specified by:
        getCostOfColumnGroup in interface ICostEstimate
        Parameters:
        g - Column group to estimate the cost of
        Returns:
        The Cost of this column group

      • shouldAnalyze

        public boolean shouldAnalyze​(CompressedSizeInfoColGroup g1,
                             CompressedSizeInfoColGroup g2)
        Description copied from interface: ICostEstimate
        Decide if the column groups should be analysed, or the worst case join should be expected. This is use full if the column groups are very small and the in practice difference between joining or not is small. Or in the other case where there is some obvious reason why these two groups does not fit together.
        Specified by:
        shouldAnalyze in interface ICostEstimate
        Parameters:
        g1 - Group 1
        g2 - Group 2
        Returns:
        If the joining should be analyzed.
